title: Kelly Rowland and Michelle Williams have a Destiny's Child reunion at Tyler Perry Studios gala
text:
Kelly Rowland, 38, and Michelle Williams, 39, hugged on the red carpet at the Tyler Perry Studios grand opening gala in Atlanta on Saturday.

The dynamic duo, who rose to fame in the girl group Destiny's Child with Beyonce in the 1990s, posed up together for the cameras.

Although Beyonce was not glimpsed on the red carpet, though she did post Instagrams of the glittering gold dress she wore to the bash.

Fab: Kelly Rowland (left), 38, and Michelle Williams (right), 39, reunited on the red carpet at the Tyler Perry Studios grand opening gala in Atlanta on Saturday

For her latest red carpet outing, Kelly flashed her cleavage in a sparkling wrap dress and showed off a bit of leg through a thigh-slit.

Meanwhile, Michelle made a splash at Tyler Perry Studios in a black and silver leopard print gown with eye-catching flares.

While posing together at the event, they were joined by La La Anthony, the estranged wife of NBA free agent Carmelo Anthony.

Although Destiny's Child split up in 2006, they are still friendly, and Kelly and Michelle both attended the world premiere of Beyonce's film The Lion King in July.

All that sweet affection: The dynamic duo, who rose to fame in the girl group Destiny's Child with Beyonce in the 1990s, posed up together for the cameras

Beyonce's father Mathew Knowles, who managed Destiny's Child and nurtured their rise to stardom, is now developing a musical about the girl group.

'The main character is me, because I'm telling my perspective. It starts when the girls were very young on Star Search, up till about 2010,' Mathew told Paper in April.

'That's what we're doing more - telling my story. At 67, if I don't tell my story, someone will tell his story and it would be inaccurate.'

When you got it: For her latest red carpet outing, Kelly flashed her cleavage in a sparkling wrap dress and showed off a bit of leg through a thigh-slit

Tyler bought the Fort McPherson military base, which spreads across 330 acres, in 2015 and has now made it the site of his massive studio.

The $250 million property is the first studio owned by a black American - on ground once occupied by a Confederate base.

Tyler remarked on the historical detail while accepting the ultimate icon award at the BET Awards over the summer.

Meanwhile: Michelle made a splash at Tyler Perry Studios in a black and silver leopard print gown with eye-catching flares

'That studio was once a Confederate Army base - and I want you to hear this - which meant that there was Confederate soldiers on that base plotting and planning on how to keep 3.9 million Negroes enslaved,' he said.

'Now, that land is owned by one Negro,' he said to a standing ovation, then added: 'It's all about trying to help somebody across.'

Tyler said: 'While everybody was fighting for a seat at the table, talking about: "Oscars so white, Oscars so white," I said: "Y'all go ahead and do that, but while you're fighting for a seat at the table, I'll be down in Atlanta building my own."'

Trio: While posing together at the event, they were joined by La La Anthony, the estranged wife of NBA free agent Carmelo Anthony
description: Kelly Rowland and Michelle Williams had a mini-Destiny's Child reunion at the Tyler Perry Studios grand opening gala in Atlanta on Saturday.
